thread.title: Teacher searched ‘teen marriage’ before alleged kidnapping: police
thread.title_full: Teacher searched ‘teen marriage’ before alleged kidnapping: police | New York Post

author: Jackie Salo
title: Teacher searched ‘teen marriage’ before alleged kidnapping: police
text:
A Tennessee teacher accused of kidnapping a 15-year-old student searched “teen marriage” online before she went missing, according to authorities.
Police are looking for 50-year-old Tad Cummins, who is wanted for aggravated kidnapping and sexual contact with a minor. Culleoka Unit School student Elizabeth Thomas, who was last seen March 13, is believed to be with her former teacher.
Tennessee Bureau of Investigation officials said Tuesday that Cummins researched teen marriage online eight days before he abducted 15-year-old Thomas. He also searched whether his car had particular features that “could be tracked by law enforcement,” ABC News reported .
Jason Whatley, a lawyer for Thomas’ family, also said Tuesday that the school had been investigating a report that a student saw the pair kiss before they went missing. Cummins and Thomas denied the kiss, but the teacher said she was “a really good friend,” according to the school’s report.
Cummins was eventually suspended over the allegation until he was formally fired the day after he and Thomas disappeared.
“My client’s position, respectfully, is that Mr. Cummins should have been out the door until the police investigation was completed,” Whatley said.
The Tennessee Bureau of Investigation has issued an Amber Alert for Thomas. She was last seen around 7:30 a.m. on March 13 at a restaurant in Columbia, Tennessee.
“We need you home,” Thomas’s sister, Sarah, told ABC News. “Whatever he’s telling you is a lie… just call or text us whenever you can.”
AMBER ALERT: Here are new pictures of suspect Tad Cummins, captured the week prior to the kidnapping of Elizabeth Thomas. Please RT! pic.twitter.com/CSWajVSiGP 
— TBI (@TBInvestigation) March 20, 2017
